page.title: 04GROUSE SHOOTING IN THE BRAES
page.content: The 'Glorious Twelfth' of August sees the opening of the grouse shoot- ing season and the 'bag' at the end of each day reflects how successful the birds have been in the summer raising their young as well as how good the shooters are. Careful burning of the old rank heather before the spring encourages new young shoots on which the birds thrive. This ensures that there are plenty birds to provide sport for the affluent guests who form an essential part of the economy of the area. Careful management is also needed to make sure enough birds survive to breed the following year. Besides the gamekeepers who are employed throughout the year, locals and students are needed to drive the grouse to the butts, or to assist the shooters by loading their guns.
